attributes.action: A38 Junction Upton upon Severn needs improvement. Stationary traffic for hours
attributes.additional_details:
Worcester County Council have recognised this junction is sub standard but do not have the funding, despite funding a £8m project to raise the road by 1metre so we can now queue 365 days a year and not worry about the couple of weeks every 10 years or so that the road flooded.
20 years of using this junction, I have now idea who has the right of way when entering and turning right. Maybe a "no right turn sign" would help, making all traffic to go left and then join the road at the Defford turn
attributes.background: The junction is unsuitable for a trunk road. When joining the A38 and turning right when leaving Upton it is almost impossible to make the manoeuvre, this creates miles of queuing traffic. The junction is like a scrapyard, with car parts littered from the frequent collisions.
